metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1092 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ext4_iget function in fs/ext4/inode.c in the Linux kernel through 4.15.15 mishandles the case of a root directory with a zero i_links_count, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service (ext4_process_freed_data NULL pointer dereference and OOPS) via a crafted ext4 image. Wen Xu discovered that the ext4 filesystem implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle corrupted meta data in some situations. An attacker could use this to specially craft an ext4 filesystem that caused a denial of service (system crash) when mounted.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-23-generic - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-lowlatency - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-4.15.0-23-snapdragon - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-23-generic - 4.15.0-23.25
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-23-lowlatency - 4.15.0-23.25
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1010-aws - 4.15.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1013-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13
No subscription required
